sentences.sContent: I can’t find the car keys.
I managed to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.sCn: 我设法找出了解决问题的办法。

sentences.sContent: She woke up and found herself in a hospital bed.
sentences.sCn: 她醒来发觉自己躺在医院的床上。

sentences.sContent: ...Some team members find it hard to agree on questions like membership and the team’s purpose...
...people with this rare condition often find their unusual ability burdensome...
...One of the reasons I find this topic very interesting is because my mom was a smoker when I was younger...
...Some people with HSAM find it very hard to get rid of unpleasant memories...
...I find the in-class ones are more stressful in the short term...
...it is important to find out some ways to solve the problem...
...Students who put off their work until the last moment often find the exams more difficult than they actually are...
...the only way to cure aging is to find ways to repair that damage...
...Elderly students find it hard to keep up with the rapid changes in education...

phrases.pCn: 自我感觉；发现自己处于某种状态；发现自己的能力
v. 找出，查明；发现，揭发
结果却发现（表达出人意料或不愉快的意思）
找出；弄清有关…的情况；调查关于
找到解决办法；渗入到；推开人群挤过去（等于push one's way）

words.tran: 发现者；探测器；（照相机的）[摄] 取景器；（大望远镜上的）[天] 寻星镜

trans.tranOther: to get back sth/sb that was lost after searching for it/them
